Applications.Description1Aof3: If you have created or you know an application, website or other product that uses data, among others from the
Applications.Description1Bof3: portal and you want to share information about them on the portal - click the
Applications.Description1Cof3: button and fill in the form. We will post your proposal on the
Applications.Description2of3: Below we present examples of public data utilization in applications, products and services. We do not promote a specific solution, we only disseminate information about selected projects using data.
Applications.Description3of3: We are interested in further examples
Applications.Description4: We are interested in further examples of data use

Sparql.Description: Search for metadata for data providers, data sets and data in the RDF database using the SPARQL query language. The tool is designed for experienced SPARQL users. The SPARQL specification can be found at
Sparql.ExitFromTextAreaForSr: Click CONTROL+q to exit from multiline edit field, click CONTROL+e to exit from multiline edit field and go to the previous item

Button.TooltipText: Browse the most important features of the portal.

MyDashboard.title: Dashboard
MyDashboard.text: Access to the additional functions of the portal: password change, observation of the objects, statistics and open data laboratory.

SearchBar.title: Searchbar
SearchBar.text: The word or a phrase entered into the field are searched in all objects on the portal, i.e. titles and descriptions of datasets and data, in datasets publishers, applications, articles and knowledge base.

DataCategories.title: Select data category
DataCategories.text: The data are assigned to categories of topics. That allows for an easier access to the searched data.

Institution.title: Select data publisher
Institution.text: The data published on the portal are submitted by providers. Selecting a specific provider brings up a subpage containing information about the provider and the data set it provided.

Applications.title: Applications
Applications.text: This section includes innovative information technology solutions using public data gathered both on the portal and originating rom other sources i.e., in the form of an application for mobile devices.

Innovations.title: PoCoTo - Data reuse
Innovations.text: In this section you can see examples of data reuse, in particular IT solutions (e.g. applications, websites) that use data collected on the Dane.gov.pl portal and other sources.

SearchBar.title: Searchbar
SearchBar.text: The word or a phrase entered into the field are searched in all objects on the portal, i.e. titles and descriptions of datasets and data, in datasets publishers, applications, articles and knowledge base.

SearchBar.title: Searchbar
SearchBar.text: The word or a phrase entered in the field are searched in the contents of the attributes ‚Äì title, description, keywords ‚Äì of two objects: datasets and data.

Found.title: Found
Found.text: The searched objects are presented on a single collective list, divided per object type in separate tabs over the list.

Follow.title: Follow Button
Follow.text: Selecting this function starts the procedure continuously informing the user about all changes in the selected dataset. The changes are signalled by the notification icon displayed in the status bar in the website header.

FollowSearchResult.title: Follow search result
FollowSearchResult.text: Selecting this function starts the procedure continuously informing the user about the changes in number of searched results  for the criteria saved earlier. The changes are signalled by the notification icon displayed in the status bar in the website header.

API.title: See data via API
API.text: The button launches a new subpage containing the data in JSON format, provided by the portal‚Äôs system API. The data are used to display the contents of the current website.

RelatedShowcases.text: Examples of reusing related data from a dataset.

Data.title: Resources
Data.text: List of data available on the portal within the specific dataset. The data can be downloaded by pressing the link on the right.

Conditions.title: Restrictions on reuse
Conditions.text: Information on the conditions for reuse of the data in this dataset.

Follow.title: Follow Button
Follow.text: Selecting this function starts the procedure continuously informing the user about all changes in the selected database. The changes are signalled by the notification icon displayed in the status bar in the website header.

History.title: Dataset history
History.text: Information regarding the changes made to the dataset

DownloadAll.text: Selection of function enables download a compressed file  contains all the data (resource files) associated the dataset.

HighValueData.title: High value data
HighValueData.text: It is public sector information whose re-use has significant benefits for society, the environment and the economy, in particular because of its suitability for services, job creation and other value-added applications.

DynamicData.title: Dynamic data
DynamicData.text: Data that is subject to frequent updates due to its variability or rapid outdated.

Search.title: Searchbar
Search.text: The word or a phrase entered in the ‚ÄúSearch Provider‚Äù field are searched in the contents of the data provider attributes ‚Äì title and description. The search engine divides the entered phrase into individual words and by using the full-text mode, i.e. considering declension, searches for identical or very similar words in the searched provider attributes. The number of the searched words and their similarity to the entered template are reflected by the Accuracy parameter.  After entering the third letter, the search engine suggest the best matching objects. The suggestion changes when the phrase is entered. The search ends with selecting a suggestions or by clicking the magnifier icon.

Filters.title: Filters
Filters.text: Selecting provider type and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to providers of a specific type.  The applied filter is visible on top of the list with search results.

Search.title: Searchbar
Search.text: The word or a phrase entered in the ‚ÄúSearch Data‚Äù field are looked up in the contents of the attributes ‚Äì title, description, keywords ‚Äì of two objects: data sets and data published by a provider. The search engine divides the entered phrase into individual words and by using the full-text mode, i.e. considering declension, searches for identical or very similar words in the searched attributes. The number of the searched words and their similarity to the entered template are reflected by the Accuracy parameter.  After entering the third letter, the search engine suggest the best matching objects. The suggestion changes when the phrase is entered. The search ends with selecting a suggestions or by clicking the magnifier icon.

Self.title: Filters
Self.text: Using filters allows to match the search results to the user‚Äôs needs.

CategoryLong.title: Filters - category
CategoryLong.text: Selecting one or more categories and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets belonging to these categories.

LicenseLong.title: Filters - select license
LicenseLong.text: Selecting one or more licenses and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data shared under selecting license.

UpdateFrequency.title: Filters - update frequency
UpdateFrequency.text: You can select the frequency according to which the data is updated. The data is updated according to the periods specified by the data provider. You can select one or more frequencies. Confirm your choice with the ‚ÄùApply‚Äù button.

InstitutionLong.title: Filters - publisher
InstitutionLong.text: Selecting one or more publishers and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data provided by these publishers.

FormatLong.title: Filters - format
FormatLong.text: Selecting one or more formats and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data in these formats.

OpennessScore.title: Filters - openness score
OpennessScore.text: 5 openness levels is a useful tool used for classifying datasets with respect to openness. Higher data openness level means that the data are better prepared for further processing. Selecting one or more openness levels and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data with selected openness.

VisualizationType.title: Filters - visualization type
VisualizationType.text: Selecting one or more visualisation methods and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data having these visualisation methods.  Visualisation methods are defined by a publisher.

ResourceType.title: Filters - resource type
ResourceType.text: You can select one or more data types: API, download file or visit the publisher website with data. Clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data holding these data types.

DateRange.title: Filters - date range
DateRange.text: Selecting a range of dates and clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button restricts the search results to the datasets and data whose update dates are within the entered range.

HighValueData.title: Filters - high calue data
HighValueData.text: It is public sector information whose re-use has significant benefits for society, the environment and the economy, in particular because of its suitability for services, job creation and other value-added applications.

DynamicData.title: Filters - dynamic data
DynamicData.text: Data that is subject to frequent updates due to its variability or rapid outdated.

Search.title: Searchbar
Search.text: The typed word or phrase are searched for in the titles and descriptions of the data reuse solutions.

Suggest.title: Suggest an innovation
Suggest.text: Each author of an application based on open data can submit it to the dane.gov.pl portal administration to have it shared on the portal.

NewSuggest.title: Suggest
NewSuggest.text: Any author of an app that relies on open data can report it to the portal administrator dane.gov.pl for sharing on the portal

Search.title: Searchbar
Search.text: The word or a phrase entered in the ‚ÄúSearch Article‚Äù field are searched in the titles and descriptions.

Link.title: Link to the application
Link.text: You can check how the application works. Is some cases it also contains the technical information prepared by the author and allows to download the application from the store.

RelatedDatasets.title: Related datasets
RelatedDatasets.text: A list of open data which are used in the application.

RelatedDatasets.title: Related datasets
RelatedDatasets.text: A list of open data which are used in the {param}.

Link.title: Link to the application
Link.text: You can check how the {param1} works. Is some cases it also contains the technical information prepared by the author and allows to download the {param2} from the store.

Search.title: Searchbar
Search.text: The word or phrase entered in the ‚ÄúSearch...‚Äù field are searched in in text-type columns in whole table. Selecting the ‚ÄúShow Filters‚Äù button grants you with access to the filter definition section.

Filters.title: Show filters
Filters.text: When defining a filter, we must select a column, operator and value. More than one filter may be defined.

Table.title: Table
Table.text: Table containing data presented in a table.

Chart.title: Chart
Chart.text: Tab allowing to present the data as a chart.

Map.title: Map
Map.text: Tab allowing to present the data on a map.

Parameters.title: Show parameters/Hide parameters
Parameters.text: The button displays/hides a section allowing to define a chart. The user may create their own chart.

ShowChart.title: Preview chart
ShowChart.text: Select the ‚ÄúDisplay chart‚Äù button to see a defined chart.

SaveChart.title: Save chart
SaveChart.text: Select the ‚ÄúSave chart‚Äù button to permanently save the chart. The function is available to logged in users.

MapSettings.title: Map options
MapSettings.text: It is possible to limit the number of points displayed on a map to the area that interests us by using your location or by clicking a point on a map and entering radius.

ApiValidation.title: API Compliance Validator
ApiValidation.text: A tool that allows you to check whether the API is compliant with the API standard.

UseCases.Description1of2: Access to datasets via API with support for search engines. You can find more information in
UseCases.Description2of2: in the main CKAN Data API documentation and the DataStore extension (in English).

User.NewPasswordCreationDescription: Enter the e-mail address, and then check your e-mail address, to which we will send you a link to the new password creation form.
User.NewPasswordCreationDescription1of3: A password change link will be sent to the provided e-mail address. If it does not work, please use
User.NewPasswordCreationDescription3of3: and enter the code you received in the message
User.NewPasswordCreationLinkSent: Link to the new password creation form has been sent to your email address. Please check also your Junk/Spam folder.
User.RodoCheckboxText: I acknowledge having been acquainted with the Privacy Policy and the GDPR made available on dane.gov.pl
User.RegulationsCheckboxText: I acknowledge having been acquainted with the regulations made available on dane.gov.pl
User.SuccessfullRegistration: Your registration has been successfully submitted
User.PasswordChanged: Your password has benn successfully changed
User.ActivationEmailSent: Activation link has been sent to your email address. Please check also your Junk/Spam folder.
User.AccountActivated: Your account has been activated. You can now log in.
User.LogInToFollow: If you want to follow datasets log in or register. Following datasets is available to users who have an account on the portal.

Validation.RequiredEmail: "E-mail" field is required and must be valid
Validation.InvalidWebsiteUrl: Invalid website url. The address should contain the prefix: https://*
Validation.VarMinLength: Field should be at least {param, plural, =1 {1 character} other {{param} characters}} long
Validation.AtLeastOneOption: Please select at least one option
Validation.RequiredPasswordConfirmation: "Retype password" field is required and its content must match password entered before
Validation.PasswordPolicy: Password should be at least 8 characters long including one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, number and one special character
Validation.VarPasswordPolicy: Password should be at least {param, plural, =1 {1 character} other {{param} characters}} long including one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, number and one special character
Validation.VarMaxFieldLengthExceeded: Maximum field length is exceeded by {param, plural, =1 {1 character} other {{param} characters}}
Validation.RodoCheckbox: Please accept privacy policy and GDPR
Validation.RequireOneUrl: At least one link is required to be completed
Validation.RequireDataFromList: A dataset must be selected from the list

WriteUs.Info1of2: Describe exactly what data in your opinion should be available on our website. We will analyze the submitted proposals and discuss with potential suppliers the opportunity to share them
WriteUs.Info2of2: Please add also your suggestions for improving the website
WriteUs.EmailLabel: Enter your e-mail (if you want to receive the response)
WriteUs.Suggestions: Write to us at the e-mail address provided below:
